message: G'Day, I'm building a website for a game that I'm making this week, and I was wondering if there is a way I can embed a convore group into my site? I love convore, and fully intend to use it as a consolidation / replacement between a forum system and IRC channel.

Typically I would run both a forum and and irc channel, with the irc channel embedded above the threadlist of the forum. With convore, i could just have a single, sexy interface that serves both purposes perfectly.
Oh, and the scope of the website; it will be a home page with a navigation bar and an embedded video, an about page, a contact page, and the discussion page, which is where i want convore.
@italiano40 Is that final, or a "not for now" ?
@JustSuds idk I am not a convore dev, probably just for now, convore is technically in beta status so it probably will not happen for awhile

@JustSuds It's on my wish list and if the convore team wants this service to take off it would help to make it easy for us to embed groups or topics in our websites. Just a little link "embed" that brings up the code and we're good to go!

It would look something like this. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/18809996/Convore/Mockup.png (with my sites custom dark grey background or image where convore has all the light grey. the convore logo would also be completely clickable, and should be the only link that directs away from my page)

maybe clicking on a user's name would also redirect to the convore hosted page. But clicking on a thread in the list on the left should literally just replace the content of the right pane, rather than redirect to a convore page
If they make an embed they should make it clean and not just a piece of the site it should be the content and put in a very general container
Would you pay for a Convore embed feature?

@Ade_Lack The embed feature would help convore get users. We have a chicken and egg here without users the groups are worthless and we need things like embedding to get users. IMO convore will be in an excellent position to make some $$ when they have millions of users and are growing at a rapid rate. Then they can go to advertisers and offer super targeted advertising at high rates. Imagine going to Nikon and offering them banner ads in the "Camera" group when such a group gets thousands of postings a day and has 20,000 active members. Now that's valuable. The $$ is in the large public groups. The BIG question is can convore survive long enough to reach critical mass. Sure, there can also be a pro version without the ads. Just my 2 cents.

@Ade_Lack @craigshipp Yes, i would pay for a convore feature. And I would much rather a paid membership, than ads. Any day of the week. I'd especially hate it if ads were compulsory and appeared in embedded groups.

@JustSuds you buy the pro option and the ads go away. Depending on how the ads are displayed I'm not sure they would bother me. But that's the beauty of having a paid no ad version we all get what we want :)
